• Pro-Gym is a Fitness & Workout Utility Android Application. 

• Developed by Victor Chow for his Honours Project as part of the University of Dundee's Applied Computing course (Bsc Hons). 

• The aim of this application is to provide informaiton and tools to new users, and does not require them to join a gym. 

• All the workouts provided insde the Pro-Gym application, do not require any gym equipment and can be completed at home. 

• Pro-Gym aims to provide a series of basic utilities e.g. Timers, Stopwatches etc. in addition to a category of workouts. 

• The Pro-Gym application can also be used with the Samsung Galaxy Gear Live Smartwatch. 

• All icons were obtained through the website: http://www.flaticon.com/ 

• Any problems or bugs can be e-mailed to the developer at: victorchow507@gmail.com.
Welcome to Pro-Gym: Fitness & Workout Utility Application.
Any problems or bugs can be e-mailed to the developer at: victorchow507@gmail.com.

• Select any of the categories: Workouts: Utilities, Calorie Tracker, Run, Advice to access their functionality. \n• Select the Home icon on the Action Bar to return to the Home Screen at any time. \n• Select the Menu icon on the Action Bar to view additional features.

• Provies a category of workouts that can be completed without access to a gym. \n• Select any of the categories: Arms, Upper Body, Core, Legs or Cardio to view related workouts. \n• Select any of the workouts displayed to view more detailed information about the related workout.

• Provides a selection of utilities that can be used to aid your fitness/workout routines. 
• Select any of the categories: Timer, Stopwatch, Pedometer, Heartbeat Counter.


• Timer: 
	• Touch anywhere on the Hours/Minutes/Seconds to set the timer. 
	• Select the Reset button to reset the timer abck to 00:00:00. 
	• Select the Start button to start the timer countdown. 
	• Select the Stop button to stop the timer countdown.


• Stopwatch: 
	• Touch anywhere on the Hours/Minutes/Seconds to set the stopwatch. 
	• Select the Reset button to reset the stopwatch back to 00:00:00. 
	• Select the Start button to start the stopwatch counter. 
	• Select the Stop butotn to stop the stopwatch counter. 
	• Select the Lap button to lap the stopwatch counter.


• Pedometer: 
	• Select the Start button to start the Pedometer. 
	• The number of steps will be displayed on-screen. 
	• Select the Stop button to stop the Pedometer. 
	• Select the Reset butotn to reset the Pedometer back to 0 steps.


• Heartbeat Counter 
	• Select the Start button to start the Heartbeat Counter. 
	• Place your finger on the Heartbeat sensor located on your device. (Varies on each device. Not all devices have this sensor.) 
	• The Heartbeat Counter will run for 6 seconds, then calculates your Heartbeats Per Minute (BPM). 
	• Select the Reset button to reset the Heartbeat Counter. 
	• There is a chart provided to measure your BPM against.

• Select the Start button to begin your run. \n• The GPS function must be enabled on your device. \n• The GPS function will track your location and calculate the distance travelled and average running speed.
• Advice related to Workouts and general Fitness lifestyle will be displayed on-screen. \n• Cycle through advice by using the navigation buttons provided.

• Configure the settings of the application based on your preferences. 
	• Enable Notifications. 
	• Select Themes. 
	• Select Alarm Sounds 
	• Clear personal data stored on device. 
	• Reset back to default preferences. 
	• Save preferences and apply them.
• Visit the Google Playstore to check for new updates.
Studies show that eating slow-digesting carbs (whole grains) before workouts, helps your burn more fat and increases endurance levels.
Consume whey-protein after a workout to help repair damaged/fatigued muscles, leading to an increase in muscle mass.
Use forced reps on your last sets to maximize your workout efficiency.
Heavy weights and lower reps increases strength and overall muscle size. Lower weights and higher reps increases endurance.
Always stretch afer training to prevent injuries to your muscles.
Keep yourself well hydrated throughout your workout/fitness routine. Drinks with electrolytes are most efficient at rehydrating your body after a workout, and replishes your salt levels.
It takes roughly 10 minutes on the treadmill to burn off 100 calories.
Changing your diet to include more carbs and protein will help you increase your muscle size and weight gain.
Triceps make up 2/3 of your upper arm. Train these to make your arm look bigger overall.
To lose fat around the abs, do workouts that target that specific area rather than doing general cardio exercises.
After an effective workout, your muscles should be in pain the following day.
Muscle gain is the process of tearing your muscle fibres by working out, then repairing them with protein.
If you are struggling to keep your weights steady, then you are prone to injury.
Ensure you are using proper form when lifting heavy weight. Proper form will help you workout more efficiently and to avoid injuries.
Do not work out everyday, your body needs at least 1 or 2 days to relax and recover.
Staying hydrated increases your Energy and Focus. You will complete your exercises more easily and benefit more.
Staying hydrated increases your Physical Strength by approximately 10-20%.

Your body cannot lose water without losing sodium and vice versa, you cannot retain water without retaining salt. Drinking sports drinks over pure water is more effective at rehydrating after a workout/fitness session.
Your muscles needs time to recover after a day of working out. Alternate between other parts of the body on different days.
